PathGenerator module

class PathGenerator.PathGenerator[source]

Bases: object

Generates and checks the satisfiability of paths within a finite state machine (FSM) based on a given JSON representation of transitions.

static check_path_satisfiability(fsm, file_name)[source]

Checks the satisfiability of each path within the Finite State Machine (FSM) and outputs the results to a Python file for execution.

Parameters:

  • fsm (dict) – The finite state machine representation.

  • file_name (str) – The base name for the output file where Z3 code will be generated.

static find_paths(graph, start, end, path=[])[source]

Recursively finds all paths from start to end node in a graph.

Parameters:

  • graph (dict) – The graph represented as a dictionary.

  • start – The starting node.

  • end – The ending node.

  • path (list) – The current path (used in recursive calls).

Returns:

A list of paths, where each path is a list of nodes.

Return type:

list[list]

static find_transition(transitions, from_state, to_state)[source]

Finds a transition between two states.

Parameters:

  • transitions (list[dict]) – A list of all transitions.

  • from_state – The starting state of the transition.

  • to_state – The ending state of the transition.

Returns:

The found transition or None if not found.

Return type:

dict or None

static format_transition(transition)[source]

Formats a single transition into a string representation.

Parameters:

transition (dict) – The transition to format.

Returns:

The formatted string representing the transition.

Return type:

str

static group_transactions(transition_json)[source]

Groups transitions from the JSON representation of a Finite State Machine (FSM) into paths from the initial to final states.

Parameters:

transition_json (dict) – The JSON representation of the FSM’s transitions.

Returns:

A dictionary where keys are string representations of paths and values are lists of transitions for each path.

Return type:

dict
